Can you post steps to reproduce this exception?
Just let update manager try to install the update and after the user is prompted about installing a signed feature the update then fails with the message in my initial posting.

I have similar problems with installing the signed itext feature.

Kim, what do we do when Europa archives have SHA1 errors?
I would ask the BIRT team to verify the jar using jarsigner -verify.

What's the Eclipse platform version you're using for installing update jars?

I've tested BIRT update site installed successfully without any exceptions.

For signed/packed update jars, you'll have use Eclipse 3.3M6 or higher version to update.

Platform team has not release this fix to their 3.2.X release yet. So it's sure to get exceptions if you like to install BIRT 2.2 on Eclipse 3.2.2 thru update manager.

There is 2 category in BIRT update site. One is 2.1 and the other is 2.2.
All 2.1 feature are not signed and packed. You should choose features under 2.1 category to install.
Can this bug be resolved as "woks for me"  using BIRT's 2.1.x features?
